Materials and You A Guide to Tools and Abilities
Volume 2 By Skyla
Table of Contents

Welcome to the second edition of Materials and You: A Guide to Tools and Abilities. Within these pages you will details on every known tool, modifier, and material. A detailed breakdown of everything known, and a few unknowns, lie here.
This book is a magic copy; it updates whenever the original has been modified. Check back occasionally for information on new things.

page.title: Pickaxe
page.text: The Pickaxe is a basic mining tool. It is the simplest method of chewing through rock and harvesting ores.
Class: Precision Tool Effective on: Stone or rock, ores, and metal.

page.title: Shovel
page.text: The Shovel is a basic digging tool. It is the most common way of moving earth around.
Class: Precision Tool Effective on: Dirt, sand, and snow.

page.title: Axe
page.text: The Axe is a basic chopping tool. It is the simplest way to shape lumber.
Class: Precision Tool Effective on: Trees.

page.title: Mattock
page.text: The Cutter Mattock is a versatile farming tool. Its primary purpose is to till soil. It also works somewhat like an axe and a shovel, but is not a replacement for either.
Class: Multitool Effective on: Wood, dirt, and plants.

page.title: Broadsword
page.text: The Broadsword is a defensive weapon. It is a favorite of many Tinkers and is useful in a wide variety of situations.

Right-click: Block - Blocking cuts a wide variety of damage types in half.
Class: Melee Weapon Effective on webs.

page.title: Longsword
page.text: The Longsword is an offensive weapon. It is used for full-speed charges and plowing through enemy lines

Right-click: Lunge - When released, it sends you careening forward at breakneck speed.
Natural Abilities: - Charge Boost, does 1.5x damage and knockback while sprinting
Class: Melee Weapon Effective on webs.

page.title: Rapier
page.text: The Rapier is a special weapon. The dancing swordplay lets you get in and out of battle quickly. While the Rapier's damage is low, it makes up for this with its other abilities.

Right-click: Backpedal - Take a small hop backwards
Natural Abilities: - Charge Boost, does 2x damage and knockback while sprinting. - Armor Pierce, ignores armor and blocking. - Quick Strike, the enemy is stunned for less time.
Class: Melee Weapon

page.title: Frying Pan
page.text: The Frying is a heavy weapon that uses sheer weight to stun foes or a place to cook your food. It is common to hunt pigs and cook them with the same pan.

Right-click: Block - Blocking cuts a wide variety of damage types in half.
Shift+Right-click: Place Item - The frying pan cooks a large amount of food at a time.
Natural Abilities: - Heavy, does extra knockback and stuns the foe.

page.title: Battlesign
page.text: The Battlesign is an advance in weapon technology worthy of Zombie Pigmen everywhere.

Right-click: Block - Blocking cuts a wide variety of damage types in half.
Class: Lethal Joke Weapon

Material Abilities
Some materials have abilities that augment their natural uses.
Reinforced: 10% chance per level of not using durability Shoddy: Mines faster and does less damage as the tool breaks Spiny: Opposite of Shoddy Writable: One extra modifier per piece Awareness: Unknown

page.title: Wood
page.text: It seems to grow everywhere.

page.title: Stone
page.text: One of the most common materials in the world.

page.title: Iron
page.text: A staple for tools, it can be refined and processed.

page.title: Flint
page.text: More durable than stone. The material of choice for cavemen.

page.title: Cactus
page.text: A form of wood found only in the desert.

page.title: Bone
page.text: A material with many uses dead or alive.

page.title: Obsidian
page.text: Tough as nails, but fragile when shaped.

page.title: Alumite
page.text: An uncommon alloy. It seems to be quite durable.

page.title: Netherrack
page.text: This is made of what?!

page.title: Blue Slime
page.text: Converting it from food has made it stronger.

page.title: Green Slime
page.text: Soft and springy, it seems to last forever.

page.title: Paper
page.text: It's very weak, but can take a lot of modification.

page.title: Cobalt
page.text: One of the nether materials. It's bright blue.

page.title: Ardite
page.text: One of the nether materials. It's rustic red.

page.title: Manyullyn
page.text: The nether alloy. It's stronger than diamond.

page.title: Copper
page.text: A common metal found in the ground.

page.title: Bronze
page.text: A common alloy. It's a bit better than iron.

page.title: Steel
page.text: An Iron alloy. The method for obtaining this is unknown.
